AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: Court where trial was held and made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of a stop and search, applying the Brignoni-Ponce standard; exercised discretion in giving the Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in border surveillance, control, and immigration inspections, with agents operating on roving patrol and making stops based on reasonable suspicion; its agents had recently apprehended illegal alien smugglers at or near the location of a specific stop and were entitled to question occupants about their citizenship and immigration status after a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court of Appeals: a court that has relied upon an agent's observation in cases involving stops and searches near the U.S.-Mexican border, made rulings on probable cause, upheld the use of the modified Allen charge, and found no abuse of discretion in the case of Maria De Jesus Garcia; held that the giving of the Allen charge was not error; upheld a district court's refusal to conduct a post-verdict hearing on whether the jury was coerced by a properly given Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographic location relevant to border surveillance and immigration inspections where highways intersect
